inclusion.criterion: Patients between the ages of 18 and 70 years old referred to Indiana University Hospital for outpatient upper EUS for clinical purposes (e.g., pancreatic disease).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Increased hepatic enzymes (AST or ALT) above the upper limit of normal within the past 3 months.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Evidence of fatty liver (as detected by an increase in echogenicity or brightness of the liver) by EUS exam.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Liver biopsy for suspected NAFLD is clinically indicated as determined by Dr Naga Chalasani, one of our staff hepatologists who is an expert in NAFLD.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Previous or current alcohol abuse (≥3 drinks/day for men; ≥2 drinks/day for women)
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has a history of CAD and recently noted abdominal mass with fevers/rigors and bandemia. She underwent EUS with biopsy, which showed pancreatic adenocarcinoma at the head of pancreas.
